page.title: 11Slaughtering Process of Cows
page.content: The firm has been open about 45 years. The first stage in the slaughtering of a cow is to record the ticket number which was stuck on the cow at the market. The cow is then shot and hung on an overhead rail where it is drained of blood. Next the head is removed. Then the skin is opened around the the back legs and down the middle of the underside of the carcass. After that the skin on the front legs is opened and the front legs are chained to a post. A chain is attached to the loose skin and hooked onto a Hide Puller, as the chain tightens, the skin is removed. Then the stomach and offal is removed. The final stage is splitting down the backbone and washing the two sides of beef. This completes the 'dressing' of the carcass. Much of the meat is sent to France and Germany.
